description: Notification that the trigger indicated by the object
instances has fired, for triggers with mteTriggerType
'boolean' or 'existence'.

event.Summary: Management Triggered Event fired: $v1 for target: $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerFired DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTrigger s EXAMPLE DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTargetName s EXAMPLE DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotContextName s EXAMPLE DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotValue i 9999

description: The name of the trigger causing the notification.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTrigger

description: The SNMP Target MIB's snmpTargetAddrName related to the
notification.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTargetName

description: The context name related to the notification.  This MUST be as
fully-qualified as possible, including filling in wildcard
information determined in processing.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotContextName

description: The object identifier of the destination object related to the
notification.  This MUST be as fully-qualified as possible,
including filling in wildcard information determined in
processing.
For a trigger-related notification this is from
mteTriggerValueID.
For a set failure this is from mteEventSetObject.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotOID

description: The value of the object at mteTriggerValueID when a
trigger fired.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotValue

description: Notification that the rising threshold was met for triggers
with mteTriggerType 'threshold'.

event.Summary: Management Triggered Event rising: $v1 for target: $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerRising DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTrigger s EXAMPLE DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTargetName s EXAMPLE DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotContextName s EXAMPLE DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotValue i 9999

description: The name of the trigger causing the notification.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTrigger

description: The SNMP Target MIB's snmpTargetAddrName related to the
notification.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTargetName

description: The context name related to the notification.  This MUST be as
fully-qualified as possible, including filling in wildcard
information determined in processing.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotContextName

description: The object identifier of the destination object related to the
notification.  This MUST be as fully-qualified as possible,
including filling in wildcard information determined in
processing.
For a trigger-related notification this is from
mteTriggerValueID.
For a set failure this is from mteEventSetObject.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotOID

description: The value of the object at mteTriggerValueID when a
trigger fired.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotValue

description: Notification that the falling threshold was met for triggers
with mteTriggerType 'threshold'.

event.Summary: Management Triggered Event falling: $v1 for target: $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerFalling DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTrigger s EXAMPLE DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTargetName s EXAMPLE DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotContextName s EXAMPLE DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotValue i 9999

description: The name of the trigger causing the notification.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTrigger

description: The SNMP Target MIB's snmpTargetAddrName related to the
notification.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTargetName

description: The context name related to the notification.  This MUST be as
fully-qualified as possible, including filling in wildcard
information determined in processing.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotContextName

description: The object identifier of the destination object related to the
notification.  This MUST be as fully-qualified as possible,
including filling in wildcard information determined in
processing.
For a trigger-related notification this is from
mteTriggerValueID.
For a set failure this is from mteEventSetObject.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotOID

description: The value of the object at mteTriggerValueID when a
trigger fired.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotValue

description: Notification that an attempt to check a trigger has failed.
The network manager must enable this notification only with
a certain fear and trembling, as it can easily crowd out more
important information. It should be used only to help diagnose
a problem that has appeared in the error counters and can not
be found otherwise.

event.Summary: Management Triggered Event failure: $v1 (reason: $v5) for target: $v2

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteTriggerFailure DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTrigger s EXAMPLE DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTargetName s EXAMPLE DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotContextName s EXAMPLE DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotOID o 1.3.6.1.4.1.8072.2.1.1 DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteFailedReason i -6

description: The name of the trigger causing the notification.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTrigger

description: The SNMP Target MIB's snmpTargetAddrName related to the
notification.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotTargetName

description: The context name related to the notification.  This MUST be as
fully-qualified as possible, including filling in wildcard
information determined in processing.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotContextName

description: The object identifier of the destination object related to the
notification.  This MUST be as fully-qualified as possible,
including filling in wildcard information determined in
processing.
For a trigger-related notification this is from
mteTriggerValueID.
For a set failure this is from mteEventSetObject.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteHotOID

description: The reason for the failure of an attempt to check for a
trigger condition or set an object in response to an event.
variables.name: DISMAN-EVENT-MIB::mteFailedReason

description: Notification that an attempt to do a set in response to an
event has failed.
The network manager must enable this notification only with
a certain fear and trembling, as it can easily crowd out more
important information. It should be used only to help diagnose
a problem that has appeared in the error counters and can not
be found otherwise.

event.Summary: Management Triggered Event failure: $v1 (reason: $v5) for target: $v2

For a trigger-related notification this is from

For a set failure this is from mteEventSetObject.
